Question
========

Consider the following output generated by running `git status` on the command line in the root directory of a `git` repository. 

```{bash, eval=FALSE}
git status
```


```
On branch master
Your branch is up to date with 'origin/master'.

Changes not staged for commit:
  (use "git add <file>..." to update what will be committed)
  (use "git checkout -- <file>..." to discard changes in working directory)

	modified:   quiz.Rmd

Untracked files:
  (use "git add <file>..." to include in what will be committed)

	exam.Rmd

no changes added to commit (use "git add" and/or "git commit -a")
```

Which of the following statements are true? 

Answerlist
----------
* The file `quiz.Rmd` is being tracked by `git`, and has been modified since the last commit. 
* The file `exam.Rmd` is not being tracked by `git`.
* The file `exam.Rmd` is being tracked by `git`, and has been modified since the last commit. 
* The file `quiz.Rmd` is not being tracked by `git`.
* There is a merge conflict.

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------
* True.
* True.
* False.
* False.
* False.
